model_solution:
Let $F$ be the midpoint of $\overline{AB}$.
Let $O$ be the center of the semicircle, so that $O$ is also the midpoint of $\overline{AB}$.
Let $x$ be the radius of the semicircle.
Denote by $a$ the length of $\overline{CE}$.
Denote by $b$ the length of $\overline{OC}$.
Denote by $h$ the length of $\overline{OC}$.
Denote by $d$ the length of $\overline{OD}$.
Denote by $y$ the length of $\overline{OE}$.
Denote by $z$ the length of $\overline{AD}$.

full_steps:
Let $F$ be the midpoint of $\overline{AB}$.
Let $O$ be the center of the semicircle, so that $O$ is also the midpoint of $\overline{AB}$.
Let $x$ be the radius of the semicircle.
Denote by $a$ the length of $\overline{CE}$.
Denote by $b$ the length of $\overline{OC}$.
Denote by $h$ the length of $\overline{OC}$.
Denote by $d$ the length of $\overline{OD}$.
Denote by $y$ the length of $\overline{OE}$.
Denote by $z$ the length of $\overline{AD}$.
